DataElement.preferredName: Serum Aspartate Aminotransferase Measurement Hepatic Within Protocol Upper Limit of Normal Lab Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for quantitative measurement of the amount of aspartate aminotransferase present in a sample of serum.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Serum Aspartate Aminotransferase Measurement Hepatic Within Protocol Upper Limit of Normal Lab
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for quantitative measurement of the amount of aspartate aminotransferase present in a sample of serum.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A quantitative measurement of the amount of aspartate aminotransferase present in a sample of serum.:Refers to the liver.

Concepts.definition: A quantitative measurement of the amount of aspartate aminotransferase present in a sample of serum.
Pertaining to, affecting, or associated with the liver.

Property.preferredName: Within Protocol Upper Limit of Normal Laboratory
Property.preferredDefinition: On the inside; contained in.:An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.:The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.:Laboratory; a workplace for the conduct of scientific research.

Concepts.definition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
A facility equipped and competent to conduct scientific experiments, observations, tests, investigations, and/or to manufacture chemicals or medical products.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: SGOT (AST) <=3 x ULN, unless evidence of direct liver involvement by lymphoma, then <=5 x ULN

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the AST less than or equal to 3 X ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: AST (SGOT) <=2 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: AST (SGOT) <=2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: AST (SGOT) <=2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN
ReferenceDocuments.description: AST (SGOT) < 2.5 x institutional ULN (Values post biliary stenting are allowed for eligibility).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: SGOT (AST) less than or equal to 3.0 x upper limit of normal (ULN)?
